name: Text Chunker
info: Splits msg.payload into chunks of up to 195 characters without breaking words. Joins with ` ..\n.. ` separators.

name: Chunk String
Text chunker note
info:
If there is a possibility that any new flow created could
generate a long output string, add this subflow between 
the output of the flow and the Node Tx connector 
and the string will be broken into shorter, multiple messages
at the nearest word space.

By default, the chunked message size is 197 chaacters but
there is a field in the function to change this. 

197 characters is the recommended size.

func:

 * - NonCommercial â€” You may not use the material for commercial purposes.
 * - ShareAlike â€” If you remix, transform, or build upon the material, you 
 *   must distribute your contributions under the same license.
 *
 * Full License Text: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 *
 * A simple messaging system for Meshtastic that uses the TEXTMSG serial
 * function to send selected messages triggered by received messages. 
 * There is also a dashboard page for sending and receiving messages.
 *
 * Read these notes carefully before changing anything.
 *
 * >>> The flows may look complex, but setup is simple if these notes and   <<<
 * >>> the ones on other tabs are followed. Each main function has notes.   <<<
 * >>> Have fun â€” but donâ€™t flood your local mesh!                          <<<
 *
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * SIMPLE SETUP
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * 1. Read all the notes below.
 * 2. Set the global variables below.
 * 3. Configure the Email node on this tab.
 * 4. Check or modify the trigger messages on the second tab (optional).
 * 5. Test (see below).
 * 6. Enable the Async Tx node on the third tab.
 * 7. Click the 'Send report email' inject node to receive a full main 
 *    variables setup report (provided email is setup properly).
 * 8. Go live.
 *
 * Optional steps (before going live):
 * - Disable the "Trigger daily info message" Inject node if not required 
 *   (it sends an ident message at 07:00 daily by default).
 * - Add any new message triggers to the function node on the next tab.
 * - Read comments at the top of every tab.
 * - Review comments in major function nodes if you wish to customize.
 *
 * All messages are sent and received via the primary Meshtastic channel.
 * To use this app in a private group, that group MUST be the FIRST channel
 * on your Meshtastic node. See the documentation for more details.
 *
 * More setup details: https://github.com/linker3000/MeshBop
 *
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * DISCLAIMER
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * Accuracy and results depend on your setup and third-party services.
 * Supplied â€œas-isâ€ â€” use at your own risk. No liability is accepted for
 * consequential loss or errors.
 *
 * Feedback is welcome at the address above or the GitHub Issues tab.
 *
 * NOTE: As of October 2025, Meshtastic firmware may transmit a spurious
 * character when the node powers on or off. This is a known issue, unrelated
 * to this application.
 *
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * GENERAL NOTES
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * - Some features are disabled by default.
 * - Some tabs include additional notes in the top-left corner.
 * - Enable only one tab for each type of functionality to avoid duplicate 
 *   messages (e.g. weather reports).
 *   Use good quality, stable power supplies for your node and compute 
 *   platform to ensure reliable operation.
 *
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * TESTING NOTES
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * - Disable the Async Out node on this tab before testing to prevent sending
 *   live messages. Use the debug panel to view outputs instead. Alternatively,
 *   turn off 'Transmit Enabled' on the attached node via 
 *   'Radio Configuration..LoRa'.
 * - Test further in a secondary (private) channel.
 * - Re-enable the Async Out node once testing is complete, or re-enable node
 *   transmit.
 * - Some flows have rate-limiting â€” please respect the mesh network and don't
 *   bypass or significantly change these,
 * - This tab includes an Inject node to reset all rate limiters while testing.
 *
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * SETUP
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * Define global variables below. Some may be for future use.
 *
 * EMAIL SETUP:
 * If you want emails sent (e.g., severe weather alerts):
 * - Configure the email details below.
 * - Enable and test the Email node on this tab.
 *
 * OTHER REQUIREMENTS:
 * - Set serial port parameters for Meshtastic I/O nodes (must match your radio configuration).
 * - Set latitude and longitude for weather and sea state reports.
 * - Check the time function. If time is incorrect, set the host timezone:
 *   e.g., `sudo timedatectl set-timezone Europe/London`
 */

/* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * GLOBAL VARIABLE DEFINITIONS
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 */
// Base trigger pattern (recommended: a slash followed by a pattern, e.g. "/MYTRG")
// Do not use the same basePattern as another system in the reception locale otherwise 
// both will respond to messages. The basePattern is not associated with the connected
// node's Meshtastic ID and they can be different, which is usually how things
// are set up. Checks for the trigger pattern are NOT case sensitive.
global.set('basePattern', '/MYTRG');

// Help/info trigger (set to '' to disable help message)
global.set('helpTrigger', '?');

// General region name (default: London)
global.set('region', 'London');

// Coordinates for Astro and weather data (default: Trafalgar Square)
global.set('latitude', '51.5072');   
global.set('longitude', '-0.1276');  
global.set('height', 10.0);  // Elevation above mean sea level (m)

// A descriptive name for the location (default: Trafalgar Square)
global.set('location', 'Trafalgar Square');

/* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * SEA CONDITIONS (OPTIONAL)
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 */
global.set('seaLatitude', 50.8061);
global.set('seaLongitude', -0.5453);
global.set('seaLoc', '3 miles off Littlehampton');

/* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * TIDAL FORECAST CONFIGURATION - Based on the UK Admiralty service.
 * >>> Needs a Tide Station ID and a free API key.
 * See the Sea & Tide Info tab for more information.
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 */ 
global.set('tideStationId', '0074');  // Default is 0074 Littlehampton Harbour
global.set('admiraltyApiKey', '0');
global.set('tideLatitude', 50.8062);
global.set('tideLongitude', -0.5434);
global.set('tideLoc', 'Tides - Littlehampton Harbour');

/* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * REGIONAL SETTINGS
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 */
// Language tag - used for time formatting
global.set('locale', 'en-GB');
// TZ Identifier - see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones
global.set('timezone', 'Europe/London');

/* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * EMAIL SETTINGS
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 */
global.set('emailTo', 'mailTo@example.com');
global.set('emailFrom', 'mailFrom@example.com');
global.set('emailResponse', "Email sent to [MeshBop Admin's Name]; receipt and response times are not guaranteed.");

/**
 * ðŸŒ¦ï¸ Met Norway API Contact Email
 * ---------------------------------
 * Met Norway requires a valid contact email address in case of API misuse.
 * By default, this uses the same email as `emailTo` (the alert recipient).
 * 
 * If you want to use a different contact address, uncomment the manual line below
 *   and replace the example address with your own.
 * 
 * Note: If this address is not set, the weather-fetching function will not run.
 */

// Automatically use the same address as emailTo (recommended default)
global.set('emailAddrForMetNorway', global.get('emailTo'));

// Manual override example â€” uncomment and edit the line below to use a different address:
// global.set('emailAddrForMetNorway', 'your.metcontact@example.com');

// Dashboard display colors
global.set('MBPColourLocal', '#1a1a1a');  // Local (sent) messages
global.set('MBPColourRx', '#4a4a4a');     // Received messages

/* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * SYSTEM INFO: Please do not change
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 */
global.set('version', 'MeshBop V0.61 beta.');
global.set('info',
  'MeshBop is a Meshtastic news and info messaging system. It ' +
  'uses data from various sources. Not an emergency service. ' +
  'Third-party data may be unavailable; accuracy not guaranteed. E&OE.'
);
global.set('repository', 'https://github.com/linker3000/MeshBop');

global.set('msgChunkSize', 197);  // Max message length before splitting

/* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * TIME FORMATTER
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * Reusable global function returning formatted UTC and local time.
 */
global.set('getFormattedTime', function() {
    let now = new Date();

    let utcHours = String(now.getUTCHours()).padStart(2, '0');
    let utcMinutes = String(now.getUTCMinutes()).padStart(2, '0');
    let utcTime = `${utcHours}:${utcMinutes}`;

    let locale = global.get('locale') || 'en-GB';
    let localTime = now.toLocaleTimeString(locale, {
        hour12: false,
        hour: '2-digit',
        minute: '2-digit'
    });

    return `${utcTime} UTC (${localTime} Local)`;
});

/* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * INIT MESSAGE
 * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 */
let basepattern = global.get('basePattern') ?? '[UNDEFINED]';
node.warn('Initialized with a base trigger pattern of: ' + basepattern);

msg.payload = true;
return msg;

name: Parse flow notes - READ BEFORE TESTING
info:
This node checks received messages for triggers that cause
MeshBop to send responses.

Most processing happens in the main function block, which contains
the regular expression checks, help messages, and trigger routing.

If you plan to modify this nodeâ€™s functionality, first copy and paste
a backup of the current version. Then disable it to avoid potential
double-triggering. If something goes wrong, you can restore the backed-up
function code by copying its contents back into the live function.

There are several test triggers to assist with debugging â€” edit or expand
them as needed.

Note that most test triggers on this tab set msg.test to true, which means
any output is dropped and not sent to the Async Out node. However, it will still
appear in the debug window.

If a trigger is not delineated by the base pattern defined in the setup
function on the first tab, set the variable noBase = true in its test inject node.
This allows it to be test-parsed without the base pattern being added â€” for example,
triggers such as echo (no quotes; must be the only string in the inbound message).
Take care not to create triggers that will activate excessively, especially
single-word ones such as yes.

The â€œSend real test emailâ€ trigger cannot detect whether the Email node is disabled
or if the email failed to send.

info:
The Rx and Tx nodes must be configured to match the
async (serial) port used on this device to communicate
with the mesh node.

The Tx (transmit) node may be disabled in downloaded code updates
to reduce the risk of misconfiguration spamming the mesh.
Enable this node only after thoroughly testing your setup.

If running on a Linux system and your async In and Out nodes donâ€™t work
or donâ€™t show as â€œconnected,â€ you may need to add the account running Node-RED
to the dialout group (or the equivalent for your distribution).
This is well-documented â€” try a web search for â€œlinux dialout serialâ€.

There is a junction node linking the second output of the output-processing node
to the ident-sending node. This should be disabled by default; otherwise, all
sent messages will be followed by a MeshBop ident. This link is for testing only,
and such messages are rate-limited to avoid spamming.

V2.0 2025-10-16

This flow retrieves news headlines from the specified source.

Input options:

Default = 5 articles returned. Example: /l3kn

,[number] Returns that many headlines (maximum 10).
Example: /l3kn,5

,u Returns headlines with a TinyURL link at the end pointing to 
the full article on the BBC News site.

Examples: /l3kn,u /l3kn,5,u /l3kn,u,5

V2.0 introduces news source identifiers - see the 
"Set news feed" function comments.

Headlines are truncated to fit a single message, including the TinyURL if added.

This flow can be modified to retrieve news from other sources.
If applicable, other news flows will be made available on the projectâ€™s GitHub page.

If you develop a new flow for another news source, please share it.

name: Notes: Severe weather warnings
info:
** For V0.52 onwards, this flow requires the additional plugin: node-red-contrib-cron-plus**

Flow V0.1: Improved message assembly.

This flow runs regularly via an inject node that auto-triggers.

The first part of the flow retrieves severe weather information from the UK
Met Office using one of the regional RSS feeds from the list below.

The flow will need to be modified if warnings need to come from a
different weather service, or if the Met Office changes the format
of their warnings.

List of Met Office RSS feeds:
https://weather.metoffice.gov.uk/guides/rss

This flow sends a Tx message when a warning is available, and it can also
send an email â€” enable this link if you wish.

The second part of this flow retrieves thunderstorm and high wind warnings
from Open-Meteo. This section is disabled by default but can be enabled and
used if the UK Met Office is not suitable for your needs.

Remember to set your latitude and longitude on the first tab so that the
weather information is retrieved for the correct location.

Disable the Async Out node on the Rx/Tx tab while testing any changes made here.
Re-enable it when you are sure everything is working as expected.

Regional customisations may be available on the projectâ€™s GitHub page:
https://github.com/linker3000/MeshBop

Open Meteo note
info:
Provided here as an alternative to the Met Office service

Open Meteo imposes its own rate limiting for fetching the weather.

It is also a very busy API and sometimes requests do not get processed.

This limit can be hit easily during testing, so if no weather info
is returned or the http request stalls for a while, wait and try again
before suspecting there is an issue with any flow or logic.

The default weather message uses the 'full string' output from the
function block, with the component parts available on the other outputs.
